reviewText: This is the first and so far only accurate simulation of WW2 kamikaze missions I've ever played and I'm pleased to say that it does it well. I feel my burning Japanese spirit swell up with pride as I dodge the yankee devil danmaku and sacrifice myself so that my comrades might walk over my corpse and onward to victory. This is the spirit of kantorai, something you gaijin would never understand. Long live the Emperor. I give this game 10/10.

reviewText: This is one of the best bullet hells here avaliable on Steam (of course it's not touhou but it does its work pretty well), and it's totally worth it (more if you can get it on sale). The third part of the Gundemonium Recollection, and a vertical scroll (instead of horizontal like its predecessors), with very charming characthers and of course a japanese touch. The other two games of the Gundemonium Recollection are great too, so if you want to get it, don't doubt it.

reviewText:
The closest thing you can find to proper bullet hell on Steam.

Hard, no surprise, but it gets harder. Instead of playing as a single character with 4-some lifes, but instead, you play as a dozen dolls with a maz of a dozen lifes each, only if you have to gems.
Unlike Touhou, bombing is both the real challenge and the main gimmick of this game. To bomb, you need to survive until your FLOW bar maxes out, and then, RUN FACE FIRST INTO THE CLOSEST ENEMY YOU FIND, WHAHAHA!!! Seriously, when you run into an enemy, your doll explodes, doing massive damage and basically killing everything inside it's lengthy radius. It's the only way you can beat many of the bosses without Timing Out, Timing Out = Hard to dodge bullets and No respawning, you die there, game over.

Hold for the nigh-unfair difficulty, and dumbass doujin game devs not knowing what the hell the options are, or what a mouse is, it's the closest thing to bullet hell you can get, and is it hell.
Dark Souls can suck it.
voteText: 9 of 11 people (82%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
If you want to enjoy this game, you NEED to read the manual. Playing this blind is odious and how you need to play it is not as obvious as most other shmups.
The thing about having to crash against the bosses to kill them is interesting, but just as you would think, is very annoying to pull off since if you get hit by a bullet it negates the explosion and that's what's most likely to happen as you near the boss you're trying to attack.
The thing about the game entering sudden death mode when the timer runs out on the bosses, sure, it enforces the suicide bomb playstyle expected from the game, but will be an immediate turn down for anyone who, like me, came expecting a traditional shmup and didn't look for the manual. So, hopefully, you'll read the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing game up. It still makes boss fights really annoying if you take too long to beat them, which is more likely than not since you'll spend most of your time running into bullets while trying to suicide into the boss. Hopefully this problem is solved once you give yourself enough practice and time to learn the game, I did not give myself that many.
One thing I remember from this game is that there were a couple patterns on ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing easy that did not ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing belong on easy.
One thing that bothered me a lot is that once you die, you get a short time to select a new character to send out, which you can select with the arrow keys. DON'T. Just ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing DON'T. If I want to select a new character before spawning, at least let it be only with the actual character selection keys. It's REALLY annoying when I set some character to be the next one to go out, and then when the current one dies, a completely different one is sent out because I didn't let go of the arrow keys or I pressed it too early.

reviewText: Dis ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• be kawaii as hell dawg.

A very fun bullet-hell shooter.

The main gimmick, for the genre, is that you can choose between 8 types of dolls, each with heavily varying abilities, and none ever come out as useless.  You can buy multiple of each, as they act as your lives, and you can also use these dolls, when their FLOW is maxed/after a set amount of time, to bump into the enemies (easier said than done in most cases) and unleash a powerful explosion, the key to success in this game.  These are really fun and rewarding mechanics.

Given it's a bullet-hell, expect it to be pretty tough.

YOU SHALL SEND YOUR DOLLS OUT ON A SUICIDE MISSION INVOLVING MANY JAPANESE RIDDLED BULLETS THAT TAKE UP MOST OF THE SCREEN\n\nIf there wasn't a timer every time I reached a boss and if they just quit their ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• engrish I'd actually like this game more.

reviewText: Sadly this is a bit of a nose dive in terms of quality compared with the previous Gundemonium games. It's got all kinds of weird mechanics that simply don't work well in a bullet hell game and I feel alienated. You certainly cannot play this like any other shooter as the game constantly encourages you to get close to larger enemies and die to perform the most damage and most of the time you'll hit a bullet on your way there and waste that life. The bullets are also a lot faster, the character speeds more varied making it very difficult to pick up. Even the best players die constantly, making an attempt to be good at this game very undesirable and unrewarding.\n\nWith that said the Arrange Soundtrack is still awesome so feel free to get this on sale just to get a copy of the game's music!

reviewText: An interesting gimmick for a bullet hell. You have to charge up a bomb by surviving during boss fights then suicide dive the boss to do any damage. If you get hit by a bullet, you die and therefore don't blow up and do damage, enjoy sitting around charging your bomb again. Better hurry up though, the boss goes full lunatic mode if you take too long. Oh and also, you can't run into the parts that are vulnerable while the boss is moving, because that means it's attacking and therefore makes it so you don't explode on contact for some reason. It's an interesting gimmick, but that doesn't make it fun.
voteText: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText: An oddity among bullet hells in which the player can gather a huge armada of higly specialized, highly disposable kamikaze ships. Hitogata Happa's mechanics inspire in me a wild ambivalence. It is absurd, demanding, and masochistic in ways that no other shooter would dare. This game brings so many gimmicks to the table along with such a relentless difficulty that at first pass it seems like some kind of sick joke, but  I can't help but feel a certain fondness for its vaulting imagination.  In between the whimsical dolls named after tea leaves and the massive German flying machines there's a mechanically tight game with plenty of heart that just begs to be replayed again and again. After all, success really comes down to bringing the proper tool for the job, and knowing how to use it.\n

reviewText:
Hitogatta Happa would be a game that you'll hate to hate. It's a quite engaging little manic shooter, DoDonPachi-style, based on a buyable/sacrificable ship-bomb mechanic.
A somewhat interesting feature that you'll forget rapidly when you'll be confronted to the load of flaws that the game suffers and the intense amount of frustration coming from cruel and unusual gameover mechanics (You need to suicide your doll/ship on the boss to bomb him, and inflict enough damage to kill him before the timeout, whatever your skill is, this becomes overly complicated passed stage 2).

Buy it only if you're really into manic shooters and are looking for a new game to beat.
Otherwise, I can only advice you to spend your money on other games.

4.5/10

Pros :

+ Relatively cheap
+ Localized
+ Not that bad

Cons :

- Glitchy controls on keyboard
- Unreadable action
- Terrible HUD
- Uninspired patterns
- Unfairly punishing instakill-on-timeout" mechanic
- No visible hitbox ? Seriously ?
- Locked in 640*480
- Gratuitous engrish everywhere.
- Frustratingly near from being an actually good game
"

reviewText: Hitogata Happa is a Japanese bullet hell shoot‚Äôem up that will not only test your patience but your skill and reaction time as well. I have played lots of bullet hell games on steam, but none can hold a candle to how hardcore Hitogata Happa is. The bullet patterns are absolutely insane and the fantastic musical score will get you pumped as you wade through endless walls of impassable bullets. Unlike other games, Hitogata Happa offers you a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• ton of ship variety. Each ship has its pros and cons which require practice for an understanding of how they work. Boss fights are epic and they all have extra mechanics that make them extra fun to fight. Sadly, no matter how much I love this game, it‚Äôs not for everyone. It is very hard; the first boss fight will rage quit most people. However, if you are a fan of Japanese bullet hell, this is the best you are going to get until TouHou makes it to steam.

reviewText:
I'm not a flying shooter fan, and this one is definitely the hardest of the bunch.

Read the instruction manual before the game -- a key concept is that you need to sacrafice your lives to get past certain parts of the board.

Hardcore flying shooter fans will like this game, everyone else, stay away - or get something to punch when you can't complete level 0 (the mandatory intro level).

For my tastes, this is a great flying shooter, but I just don't like it.

1/5

reviewText: Create your very own armada of cute little girls,then blow 'em up.
Buy this game. NOW
If your thinking about touhou, get it.

After a while, you're finally there: in the Zone. In a trance-like state of mind you maneuver around endless barrage of enemy ships and their missiles while banging your fire-button like a madman because autofire simply isn't fast enough... and then you get hit. You got hit and it's frustrating, because you know it was all your fault. You almost got it. You've almost memorized all the patterns. Almost. It's hard, cruel and unforgiving, but not impossible. You know it, because you almost got it. You're so close to making it all the way through, but you're still quite not there yet. It almost makes you give up and admit your defeat. Almost. But you try one more time. Just one...\n\nAfter a while, you're finally there: in the Zone. In a trance-like state of mind...
It's a good game.

Despite how ducking cute it looks, this is one of the hardest yet most addicting games in centuries. Worth it, even at full price.\n\nA pesar de lo jodidamente cuco que se ve, es uno de los juegos m√°s jodidos pero adictivos desde hace siglos. Merece la pena incluso a precio completo.

An amazingly challenging but fun danmaku game; nothing absolutely groundbreaking graphics are similar to most other games of the genre (although the soundtracks is on par with something like Project Touhou), but thats still pretty good. Anyways I thuroughly recomend this game to anyone whose a fan of the genre and does not get annoyed with difficulty. Also this goes for the whole series not just Hitogata Happa.
Kamikaze loli simulation
[NASHEED INTENSIFIES]

- Very challenging
- Lots of interesting gameplay mechanics.
- A lot of replayability
- Amazing soundtrack, which is also included when you buy the game

The only issue is that one of the mechanics is not straight forward. So, after you've tried the first stage for the first time and failed (which is prolly gonna happen at the first boss), take a minute to read this guide.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=169062821

One of the three gundemonium games and the only one to be a vertical shooter instead of the horizontal. Without any explanation it's a bit tough to start out. The game looks likes a standard shmup (shoot em up) game with bullet shooting, slowdown but there is one thing which is not clearly explained... how to use a bomb. As your doll stays on screen for some time your flow meter will go up and once it hits max you'll get a notification on your char which says bomb. All you need to do now is ram into your enemy. That's how you use a bomb. Sacrifice one doll's life to do massive amount of damage to the enemy. At first you're stuck just using a bunch of dolls named leaf, but as you progress you can buy different ones and each doll has a different style of attack, mana attack and bomb. Coming from someone that's played a lot of touhou and cave co, ltd games, it's not bad but I wish the characters would move faster. At least add an autofire button like most cave shmups.
Hardcore beauty :¬¥)
So...many....bullets......

Right now, my favorite vertical scrolling shooter. Intense bullet-pattern action with over 7 playable characters, four difficulty settings, and two extra modes. The unique explosive humanoid dolls system allows one to sacrifice a doll when the Flow gauge is maxed for extreme levels of damage to enemies, and brings a level of strategy to selecting dolls to bring to battle as dolls handle, attack, and bomb differently. Good value alone for people who like curtain fire scrolling shooters, totally worth having as a part of the Gundemonium Collection as a whole.
'Bullet hell' doesn't begin to describe it, but what style and action! Pretty and intense. Confirms my belief that everyone should play with dolls.

A very inovative danmaku game, that can be very challenging even to reasonably good danmaku players(like me), and is pretty much the most fun shooter I've played in a while. It has many shot types in the form of the dolls you can make, so you gotta try to find the ones that suit the situation better or just the ones you like the most. There is quite a variety of ways to deal with the paterns, but it still requires you to have good dodging abilities if you want to make it to the end, because even though you can have a big amount of dolls, they'll run out pretty fast if you start messing up. On top of that, it also has a great soundtrack, which adds pretty well to the game's atmosphere. One flaw though is that the game doesn't do a good job at explaining some of it's unique and very important mechanics, so I do recommend looking up a guide for that, or you won't get that far. But still, if you're a fan of shooters, this one is definitly not to be overlooked!

This reminds me of a dulled down version of the 'Touhou Project' except you hear alot of Japanese voices repeated in this game like Recettear everytime you die or an event happens.

This game is a vertical shooter game; its almost like Danmaku.
The controls are the same as the Touhou Project such as 'Z' and 'X' as accept or cancel.
A game where japanese girls shoot robots with their hair.

This game is quite different from other similar Doujin Vertical Danmakus (i.e Touhou) out there.
It's a little bit more leaning towards Resources management:
Your lives here are also your bombs, you're supposed to ram them into bosses for huge damage. They don't give you 30 lives on the 1st stage on Normal for nothing. Don't worry though you can purchase them back in bulk between stages.
So it's dodging the bullets, ram yourself into the big enemies and cancel bullets for heavy scoring, then use the score items to buy more lives. It's a quite different experience from normal STGs.
'Bullet hell' doesn't begin to describe it, but what style and action! Pretty and intense. Confirms my belief that everyone should play with dolls.

In this game, you play the role of a little girl and an adult girl who looks like a little girl and then up to 12 more little girls that are actually dolls. You fight neo-nazis in the 1700s and blow stuff up, and then you fight giant machines and some guy who fused himself to a machine or something. There's not a lot of dialogue in this game, but the bullets say enough. And boy, they say a lot. They won't shut up. This game is hard as balls, and the true final boss is excruciatingly difficult - even on easy. Yeah. Great game (my favorite).
Bullet hell!

While the dolls with different attack styles is nice for variety, I just can't play this. It's not even hard unless on the hardest difficulty. There's no slow down button ( I believe you slow down when you attack. Not helpful in the slightest when you need to dodge faster bullets.). Without reading the reviews here I would have never guessed that I would have to ram into the boss to deal damage with my bomb. Overall, I do not recommend this game in the series, but the other two are perfectly fine.

This is a surprising little gem of an overhead shooter. Never thought I'd be using dolls to blast massive bad guys out of the sky before. Thing is, this game is tuff even on easy mode but fun enough to keep coming back for more punishment. Other than blowing up bad guys outta the sky in this bullet hell game, you are also fighting the clock in the boss battles. I didn't care much for the clock because the boss battles were hard enough in themselves. Too have a boss on the ropes and almost dead, then lose to the clock... frustrating. In the first level you begin with only one type of doll, weak primary fire but has the most massive destructive bomb mode. Using the bomb mode is usually the fastest way to take down a boss, the difficulty is getting close enough with the bullet hell on the screen. Bomb mode isn't cheap nor easy, first the doll has to power up to it and second, you lose that doll's life in using it. But then you are going to lose it anyways if you don't beat the clock in the boss mode. Other dolls can be bought with the crystals you collected on the first level and each type has different modes of attacks and firepower and all have that bomb mode. The graphics are pretty average for a 2.5-D over the top shooter and the music is simple and doesn't distract from the game. The controls are spot on which is a must in a bullet dodging game with two modes of speed. Hold you shoot button down and you move slower allowing the finer points of dodging shots and tap to double your speed to dodge bigger things. Another positive thing about this game is it doesn't give cheap shots as you fight your way to a boss, no enemies that pop out of nowhere and boxes you in. But that doesn't keep the game from releasing dozens of enemies on the screen at a time. I really like this game even though I can only really play it on easy and this game may look simple, it's a really fun challenge. As far as recommending? I'd recommend this over 9/10ths of the other garbage overhead shooters I've seen out there...

Very rough game, but I would say that I do find it worth it because of the game's cost. It kept me entertained enough to justify it. If you never played a game like this, it's definitely worth a try, especially on sale

Also, it's a hard game, but never for a second I feel that it's hard due to a flaw in game mechanics. They are overall polished. I did eventually beat the first level, and I hope to come back

One thing I didn't like: the screen is very small unless you modify happa.ini. Setting width=-1 and height=-1 greatly enhanced the game for me, especially in windowed mode

This is the hardest shooter in the entire pack. Your lives each level are split into a number of dolls that you have to buy after each level. The number of items collected in the last level determines the amount of lives you can buy for the next.\nMy fingers shall bleed trying to master this
Bullet hell!

This is a high-octane, adrenaline-laden bullet hell shooter, with all the mandatory trappings of the genre, from the cutesy graphics to the energetic soundtrack. And let's not forget going against a vast and near-invincible foe.\n\nThe choice between various dolls makes for an interesting strategic metagame, which made Hitogata Happa a lot of fun. BTW, my suggestion is that you should use the original soundtrack, as the new arrangements may be more nuanced, but they have lost a lot of the high-octane, flowing explosiveness the original has.

Very rough game, but I would say that I do find it worth it because of the game's cost. It kept me entertained enough to justify it. If you never played a game like this, it's definitely worth a try, especially on sale

Also, it's a hard game, but never for a second I feel that it's hard due to a flaw in game mechanics. They are overall polished. I did eventually beat the first level, and I hope to come back

One thing I didn't like: the screen is very small unless you modify happa.ini. Setting width=-1 and height=-1 greatly enhanced the game for me, especially in windowed mode

>Playing game
>Practiced hard, can dodge most bullet patterns
>First level boss
>I got this
>Beat the boss
>deathanimation.gif
>Bullets in literally every direction at mach 9001
>5 lives left, no problem
>Got hit
>Game Over

10/10

UPDATE: I have since learned that to beat the boss you have to literally crash into him once you reach maximum flow. This game also does not include a manual to tell us this stuff.
Suicide simmulator 10/10

You like Bullet Hell Shooters? Look no farther, Hitogata Happa has been wooping my ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• since the day I got it. I play a decent amount of old school shooters, but I was labeled as noob again when I started this game. I recommend this game to the hardcore players that want more than the challege. It's a quick game you can pick-up and put-down, so we can all get back to our busy lives. Hitogata Happa can be played on most computers and dosent use much data so gameplay feels consistant. It's a great game, dont be discouraged by the amount of times you die. Sometime you want to die on purpose.

Do I recommend this game?
ANSWER: HELL YES!
Slower when shooting takes getting use to.
I suck at it, but it's fun.
Another great game that's worth the money!

A well-designed shooter with nice levels, but the thing that makes this one really interesting and unique is the ship selection system that adds an element of strategy to game.
This game is mental and I don't understand it at all.
